description.narrative: Improving the quality of Moldovan democracy through parliamentary and electoral support
Further strengthening of CEC and CCET professionalism of electoral administrators through trainings and support

activity-description.narrative: mol

description.narrative: 1. Centre for Continuous Electoral Training has improved capacities and training curricula, methodologies and materials, as well as a pool of certified electoral trainers (at least 40) available 2. Electoral reforms supported through provision of expertise and facilitation of dialog and consultations with Civil Society Organisations and general public on the reform actions 3. Political parties finance transparency improved through expertise and training for the implementation of the law on political party financing 4. Central Electoral Commission has a modern population register with an addresses system and inter-operable with other key state registers

comment.narrative: 1. Centre for Continuous Electoral Training lacks basic capacity to organize and conduct electoral training as this is a new institution: lack of training modules, materials, curricula; lack of a pool of professional trainers 2. Electoral reform needed in the areas of electoral administration; electoral systems; voter registration, as indicated in several OSCE/ODIHR reports 3. Law on political party financing absent 4. The State and Central Electoral Commission lacks a modern population register with an address system, integrated with other key state registers

description.narrative: 1. Electoral reforms supported through provision of expertise and facilitation of dialog and consultations with Civil Society Organisations and general public on the reform actions 3. Political parties finance transparency improved through expertise and training for the implementation of the law on political party financing 4. Central Electoral Commission has a modern population register with an addresses system and inter-operable with other key state registers

comment.narrative: 1. Centre for Continuous Electoral Training lacks basic capacity to organize and conduct electoral training as this is a new institution: lack of training modules, materials, curricula; lack of a pool of professional trainers 2. Electoral reform needed in the areas of electoral administration; electoral systems; voter registration, as indicated in several OSCE/ODIHR reports 3. Law on political party financing absent 4. The State and Central Electoral Commission lacks a modern population register with an address system, integrated with other key state registers

description.narrative: The project will support Moldova with the National Adaptation Planning process which fosters the system and capacities for medium-to long term adaptation planning and budgeting.

The goal of the project is to ensure that Moldova has a system and capacities in place for medium- to long term adaptation planning and budgeting, with the aim to reduce vulnerability of population and key sectors to the impacts of climate change.

description.narrative: 1. Number of training programmes for electoral administrators gender mainstreamed. 2. Number of women CEC members, percentage of women Heads of Electoral Commissions at rayon level 3. Number of voter education campaigns targeting specific groups of voters carried out before parliamentary and local elections 4. Number of meetings between Members of Parliament and women from rural and urban areas, especially vulnerable women, organized 5. Number of women MPs trained 6. Number of women councilors trained

comment.narrative: 1. Training programmes for electoral administrators not gender mainstreamed 2. 1 women CEC member, 36% women Heads of Electoral Commissions at rayon level 3. No particular focus on women, youth and vulnerable groups in the previous voter registration and education campaigns 4. No targeted meetings of Members of Parliament with women and their organizations. 5. Newly elected women MPs did not receive initial training 6. None of newly elected women councillors trained in 2014

1. N/A 2. At least 2 women appointed as members of CEC 3. N/A 4. At least 5 regional parliamentary forums bringing constituents from vulnerable groups, particularly women, and MPs facilitated 5. N/A 6. At least 100 women from 5 pilot districts enhanced capacities in areas of local council functioning, fostering gender equality in local development agenda, finance, fundraising and communications

1. N/A 2. Achieved. 2 women appointed as CEC members and both elected in leadership roles, i.e. chair and deputy chair 3. N/A 4. Exceeded: 10 regional policy forums/450 participants representing women organized on issues relevant to women, particularly from vulnerable groups 5. N/A 6. Exceeded: A total of 356 participants, including 321 women and 35 men local and district councilors from 23 districts, 1 municipality (Balti) and Autonomous Territorial Unit Gagauzia gained new knowledge and skills in the area of gender-responsive local governance and budgeting, communication and advocacy techniques, partnership development around gender equality agenda and fundraising techniques
